title.narrative: Nigeria - ICMPD - Udsendelsesmidler 2021

description.narrative: The overall objective of the project is to support the Nigerian Immigration Service in its institutional reform effort to modernize its Human Resource Management System to increase internal efficiency, productivity, and fairness among its workforce.

participating-org.narrative: International Centre for Migration Policy Development

sector.narrative: Facilitation of orderly, safe, regular and responsible migration and mobility

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: 3.3 Implementation capacity of the Nigeria Immigration Service to mainstream gender policy provisions strengthened and the plan of action implemented.

3.3.1 Copy of Curricula on gender mainstreaming.
3.3.2 Number of workshops organized to build the capacity of the main actors within the NIS human resource management system on gender mainstreaming.
3.3.3 Implementation of the action plan of the gender policy.
3.3.4 Copy of communication Strategy for the gender policy and the implementation of the action plan to mainstream gender issues will be formulated.
3.3.5 Number of regional conferences on gender policy

target.value: 1. At least one (1) conference on gender policy organized 2. One (1) Communication Strategy completed 3- At least two (2) training workshops for HR actors on gender mainstreaming

title.narrative: 2.2 E-learning courses for the Nigeria Immigration Service designed and uploaded to the LMS.

2.2.1 Percentage increase in the number of NIS officers trained annually.
2.2.2 Standardized assessment for each e-learning course
2.2.3 Develop a catalogue of online courses, and publish both in hard and soft copies
2.2.4 Migrate the Learning Management System (LMS) to NIS domain

target.value:
1. One (1) E-learning course catalogue
2. NIS domain hosts one (1) e-learning platform
At least 25% more officers are trained annually

title.narrative: 1.3 Curriculum of mandatory and optional courses developed, in response to the new career management tools - job competences, job descriptions, recruitment criteria, and emerging migration issues that are of relevance to the Nigeria Immigration Service.

1.3.1 Copy of updated curricula at the four (4) training schools of the Nigeria Immigration Service.
1.3.2 Copy of new curricula developed in line with the new Career Progression Framework.
1.3.3 Database of NIS trainers with requisite competences to train other officers in selected courses. All trainers competent in adult learning methodology.
1.3.4 List of para-military courses on which NIS Collaborates with other law enforcement agencies.

target.value:
1. 80% of required courses have new set of curricula and 100% existing Curricula updated for NIS training schools
2. One (1) list of internal expert-trainers of NIS officers
3. One (1) List of para-military courses that corresponds to levels of cadres with required job competences

title.narrative: 1.2 Clearly defined schemes of service and job specifications with clear delineation of duties and responsibilities at all levels of the Nigeria Immigration Service is developed, within the career progression framework to allow officers in each cadre of service to manage and shape their individual careers, while improving job performance.

1.2.1 List of Work Group members led by the human resource department of the NIS, to include representation from the Office of the Head of Civil Service of the Federation and supported by an HR expert to develop Schemes of Service for the four (4) job 22 cadres of NIS - Comptroller, Superintendent, Inspectorate, and Immigration Assistant.
1.2.2 Number of training workshop organized for the Work Group on developing a schemes of Service for the four (4) cadres and job descriptions for the 23 job categories in the NIS career structure.
1.2.3 Report of drafting workshops to develop the schemes of service, job descriptions, recruitment criteria, job competences, mandatory and optional training, and develop linkage between performance and career advancement for the Nigeria Immigration service.

target.value:
1. At least four (4) drafting workshops organized 2. 60% of all job cadres have Schemes of service, job descriptions, recruitment criteria, and job competences
3. 60% of all cadres have Lists of mandatory and optional training courses

title.narrative: 1.4 Career Progression Framework, schemes of service, and course curricula launched.

1.3.1 Tools for internal sensitization of all NIS staff on the new career management system with supervisors highlighting the key features of the system and the benefits to their staff.´
1.3.2 Report of the Launch of the NIS Career Progression Framework
1.3.3 Copies of the published Career Progression Framework

target.value:
1. One (1) Career progression launched
2. At least four (4) Internal sensitization events for staff on new career framework
3. At least #2000 copies of the career progression framework printed

title.narrative: 3.1 Gender policy for the Nigeria Immigration Service developed taking into consideration the unique challenges faced by female officers.

3.1.1 Data collected on the work environment at the Nigeria Immigration Service as experienced by female officers, specifically during the recruitment process, the challenges faced in the day to day performance of their duties as immigration officers, and investigated the perception of officers (including male) on how to attract and retain female officers at the Agency. Examined the key factors responsible for the low representation 25 on female officers in the Nigeria Immigration Service. (conducted concurrently with activity 1.1.1)
3.1.2 List of members of the Technical Working Group (TWG) on gender mainstreaming and policy development
3.1.3 Draft gender policy.
3.1.4 Number of drafting workshops organized.
3.1.5 Number of sensitization workshops of the TWG organized across the country.
3.1.6 Copy of gender policy and the plan of action.
3.1.7 Copy of the assessment on gender dimensions at the NIS.

target.value: 1. One (1) Functioning TWG 2. At least four (4) drafting workshops organized 3. One (1) Gender assessment completed 4. One (1) Draft gender policy

1. At least 4 sensitization workshops of the TWG organized
2. Gender policy and plan of action implemented

title.narrative: 1.1 A Career Progression Framework developed at the Nigeria Immigration Service

1.1.1. Data collected on career path of NIS personnel, from the recruitment phase to retirement conducted; including existing job descriptions; grading structure; and schemes of service, structural, operational and technical capacity of the four (4) NIS training schools. Data collected on ICT infrastructure and staff access to technology. 1.1.2. Validated report of the assessment. 1.1.3. List of committee members inaugurated for technical drafting comprising NIS Human Resource Department, NIS training schools, independent HR experts, ICT experts, ICMPD project staff, and the focal point for senior management. 1.1.4. Workshop report of the capacity strengthening of NIS HR personnel on career planning; career development; career pathing, and performance management. 1.1.5. Number of drafting workshops to develop the career progression framework.

target.value: 1. One (1) Validated comprehensive assessment of NIS HR system 2. One (1) Drafting committeee consitituted and inaugurated 3. At least four (4) drafting workshops of the career progression framework drafting committee organized

title.narrative: 3.2 The Nigeria Immigration Service’s institutional processes and operational guidelines reviewed and recommendations submitted, ensuring gender parity, inclusiveness and non-discrimination.
3.2.1 NIS processes conforms to new gender policy. 3.2.2 SOPs and main work documents updated for inclusiveness and non-discrimination. 3.2.3 Career progression framework gender mainstreamed.

target.value: CGI announces Gender Policy goes into effect, mainstreaming commenced

title.narrative: 2.1 E-learning platform for the Nigeria Immigration Service to host staff mandatory and optional courses deployed.

2.1.1 Data collected on IT training needs and equipment needs for e-learning.
2.1.2 Learning Management System (LMS).
2.1.3 Report of ToTs workshops for selected staff at the HQ, the Commands and at the four (4) NIS training schools on the use of the new e-learning platform.
2.1.4 Report of step-down trainings on LMS for career progression courses.

target.value: One (1) Rapid Assessment of training and equipment needs conducted

1. One (1) LMS deployed
2. At least four (4) ToT workshops conducted
3. At least sixteen (16) Step-down training workshops on LMS

title.narrative: 2. Scaled up the Career Management System through an e-learning platform (Learning Management System) to train more NIS officers on topics that are appropriate for remote learning, and requiring less physical interaction.

2.1 Address of the online platform for the Nigeria Immigration Service
2.2 Demonstration of the uploaded NIS E-learning courses.

target.value: - E-Learning program launched - NIS staff taking e-learning courses (Obs. both targets should be achived in 2023)

title.narrative: 1. Supported the Nigerian Immigration Service to develop a Career Progression Framework, creating linkages between staff performance and career advancement, defining job roles based on their complexity and the competencies required to undertake work at various levels.

1.1 Career Progression Framework developed at the Nigeria Immigration Service. 1.2 Clearly defined schemes of service and job specifications with clear delineation of duties and responsibilities at all levels of the Nigeria. Immigration Service is developed, within the career progression framework to allow officers in each cadre of service to manage and shape their individual careers, while improving job performance. 1.3 Curriculum of mandatory and optional courses developed, in response to the new career management tools - job competences, job descriptions, recruitment criteria, and emerging migration issues that are of relevance to the Nigeria Immigration Service. 1.4 New Career Progression Framework, schemes of service, and course curricula developed by the Nigeria Immigration Service launched.

target.value:
1. 60% of all job cadres in the Career Progression Framework linked to training, job competences and job descriptions.
2. 80% existing job profiles updated.
3. 80% job profiles and job competences matched with required training courses.
(Shoud be fulfilled in 2023)

title.narrative: 3. Support the Gender Policy Development and Gender Mainstreaming at the Nigerian Immigration Service, promoting gender balance in staffing and in career advancement.

3.1 Data collection on the unique challenges faced by female officers.
3.2 Institutional processes at NIS reflect gender sensitivity.
3.3 Increased fairness in recruitment and advancement under new gender policy and plan of action.

target.value:
1. At least 10% Increased representation of female officers in midlevel positions
2. NIS processes contain gender dimensions
3. At leat 25% of staff are sensitized on rights of both genders
(OBS. the targets should be fulfilled in 2022)
